verbs.description: harken (third-person singular simple present harkens, present participle harkening, simple past and past participle harkened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive, chiefly US) Alternative spelling of hearken: to hear, to listen, to have regard.
(intransitive, US, figuratively) To hark back, to return or revert (to a subject, etc.), to allude to, to evoke, to long or pine for (a past event or era).
examples: Bell argued that the manual approach was "backwards," and harkened to a primitive age where humans used gesture and pantomime.
